q: Richard Prather , a retired auto worker from Anderson, said after the Pendleton town hall that he believed Mike Pence 's reputation as a federal spending hawk would serve him well running for the governor's office. I think he would have been a good candidate for president, but I'm glad he didn't, Richard Prather said. "In the next race, he can run for president." The pro-plan union members avoid the streets and meet at an auditorium to listen to their leadership. "The crisis has been under way for three years," the man on the podium says. Many industries are dying, banks are holding on to their money, if nothing improves, unemployment will skyrocket this year. We want to ensure our future. That's why we broke labor unity and approved the Sergio Marchionne plan. The union that's been left alone is the powerful left-leaning metal workers. If its members don't agree to sign, Sergio Marchionne says they will lose their representation rights on the factory floor.

parties' usually separate seating arrangements. New York's two senators, Democrats Kirsten Gillibrand and Chuck Schumer , also sat alongside Republican senators. They both reacted positively to Barack Obama 's speech. Kirsten Gillibrand said Barack Obama laid out a bold vision for this Congress. She called last year's election, in which Republicans gained control of the House and picked up seats in the Senate "a mandate for action," rather than "for any one political party."
